resources.string: "If you are experiencing: 1) Confusion, slurred speech 2) Loss of consciousness 3) Red, hot, dry skin or profuse sweating 4) Very high body temperature Call your manager and 911"
"Stay hydrated, drink water even if you are not thirsty. Wear sunscreen."
"Don’t Over work, take short water brakes when feeling any discomfort."
"Stay hydrated, drink water at least each 15 minutes, even if you are not thirsty. Wear sunscreen. Schedule breaks in a cool, shaded area."
"Don’t Over work, take short water brakes when feeling any discomfort. Don’t spend to much time under direct sun light."

"Stay hydrated, drink water at least each 10 minutes, even if you are not thirsty. Wear sunscreen. Schedule frecuent breaks in a cool, shaded area, try to take them alongside with your water breaks. Limit physical exertion, use mechanical equipment when possible"

"Don’t Over work, take water brakes when feeling any discomfort. Don’t spend to much time under direct sun light. Don’t work alone, always be sure to tell someone where you’ll be working and the time you’ll spend there"

"BE ALERT OF THE EXTREME RISK CONDITIONS Drink water CONSTANTLY. Apply sunscreen every couple of hours. Schedule breaks in a cool, shaded area. Use cooling techniques. Watch/communicate with workers at all times"
"Don’t Over work, take water brakes when feeling any discomfort. Don’t spend to much time under direct sun light. Don’t work alone, work along side 2 or 3 people. Stop work if necesary"
